perturbation.original_text: "Shared Library Materials" means (i) proprietary research reports, letter reports, photographs, micrographs or other materials recorded in a tangible, microfilm, microfiche, and/or electronic form or media, or a combination thereof, which may contain trade secrets, know-how, methods, techniques, formulas, drawings, sketches or other proprietary materials reduced to tangible form, and which were developed by and/or contained in the Research & Development Division library at the former Alliance Research Center in Alliance, Ohio ("Research Documents") and (ii) publicly available books, textbooks, reference manuals, periodicals, journals or other publications that were located at the Research & Development Division library at the former Alliance Research Center in Alliance, Ohio ("Reference Materials"), in each case which are presently stored in certain identified vaults and storage accounts maintained with Third Party vendor document retention vendor Iron Mountain.
perturbation.changed_text: "Shared Library Materials" means (i) proprietary research reports, letter reports, photographs, micrographs or other materials recorded in a tangible, microfilm, microfiche, and/or electronic form or media, or a combination thereof, which may contain trade secrets, know-how, methods, techniques, formulas, drawings, sketches or other proprietary materials reduced to tangible form, and which were developed by and/or contained in the Research & Development Division library at the former Alliance Research Center in Alliance, Ohio ("Research Documents") and (ii) certain documents as designated by RemainCo, located at various locations deemed relevant by RemainCo ("Reference Materials"), in each case which are presently stored in certain identified vaults and storage accounts maintained with Third Party vendor document retention vendor Iron Mountain.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly defines Shared Library Materials as those located at a specific location (Alliance Research Center). The modified text redefines 'Reference Materials', a component of Shared Library Materials, to be designated by RemainCo and located at locations deemed relevant by RemainCo. This creates an internal contradiction because the Shared Library Materials definition is no longer fixed to the Alliance Research Center, introducing ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text: SpinCo shall have the sole right to determine the content contained in future editions of the Steam Book, provided, however, that SpinCo will provide RemainCo with a right of first refusal to collaborate with SpinCo to provide content related to nuclear subject matter in the forty-third (43rd) edition of the Steam Book, with allocation of costs and revenues and any attribution and Copyright ownership with respect to RemainCo contributed content to be negotiated in good faith by the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: SpinCo shall have the sole discretion regarding the content contained in future editions of the Steam Book, however, RemainCo may contribute content for the next edition of the Steam Book. Terms of collaboration shall be determined by the Company.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides RemainCo with a 'right of first refusal' to collaborate on nuclear content, guaranteeing them an opportunity to participate. The modified text changes 'sole right to determine' to 'sole discretion regarding the content' and replaces the right of first refusal with a discretionary right for RemainCo to contribute, subject to collaboration terms determined by 'the Company', a vaguely defined entity. This introduces a contradiction: sole discretion implies no obligation to consider RemainCo's input, while the latter statement suggests a possibility of contribution subject to undisclosed terms. The term 'Company' is vague.

perturbation.original_text: The Parties confirm their belief that the likelihood of confusion will not result from their respective use of the SpinCo Marks and RemainCo Marks, including RemainCo's continuing use of the name BWX Technologies and continued use of the terms "BWX", "BWX Technologies" or "BWXT" and derivations thereof and therefrom, due to the differences in the goods and services primarily associated therewith (e.g., nuclear versus fossil fuel).
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties believe that there may not be confusion arising from their respective marks given the differences in goods and services. However, if either Party becomes aware of any actual confusion or mistake occurring as a result of their uses of their respective marks, the Parties agree to communicate all details of each such instance to each other, and to cooperate reasonably to take steps to abate the cause of confusion or mistake, and to prevent any such confusion or mistake from arising again.
perturbation.explanation: The original text starts with a 'confirmation' that confusion is unlikely due to differing goods/services. The modified text starts with the term 'belief' is changed into 'there may not be confusion', which creates uncertainty. This creates a contradiction: the agreement acknowledges the *possibility* of confusion, whereas previously it was being discounted.
